abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for Eastern Indonesia region
            transport project were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Lessons learned from the
            project: Designing and phasing projects to respond to
            political and technical realities leads to better
            implementation progress. Implementing activities with
            multi-agency responsibility needs clear agreement on
            responsibilities and very explicit implementing
            arrangements, without which road safety activities remain a
            challenge. Working with governments to bring about
            institutional changes is a challenge and is likely to fail
            unless there is clear Government commitment and there is
            involvement from all Government ministries not just the
            implementing ministry. Empowering independent consultants is
            necessary if they are to carry out their responsibilities
            for supervision of the technical aspect of works.
